review: My life just got so much easier. I LOVE this thing, it has fully replaced my Chromecast because it's so much easier to use. I was constantly having to restart my Chromecast to get it to recognize my streaming attempts. With the Fire TV Stick, all I have to do is use the remote (which DOES come with it -- it's the voice recognition remote that's sold separately.) I haven't touched my Chromecast since I opened this, because all the services I use (Amazon Prime, Hulu+, Netflix) are available and insanely easy to navigate.There are only two cons:The tutorial is only shown after setup -- and by the time you get through setup, you already know what you're doingYou can't stream a feed directly from your desktop, so if you want to show something direct from your computer, you'll still need to use Chromecast. (Though honestly, the Chromecast functionality for that is so crappy, I almost wouldn't even consider it a con.)

review: So far, so good. It was very easy to setup. Streaming works perfectly and the interface is easy to navigate. I've used Apple TV, Roku and SmartTV from Sony, Samsung and Vizio and find this device to be on par with the best of them. This could be a 5 star device if the iOS app is awesome when it comes out - it could also drop the score if it doesn't work, that would be a huge detraction.We use this for Netflix, Hulu, Amazon Video, Pandora, Flixter and some games. Missing HBOGo is a bit of a bummer too, but I have it on other devices. Knowing that there will never be a device that will stream from every service I use (Apple won't carry Amazon and vice-versa, for starters) I think that this and an Apple TV are the two to get.
author: C. J. Pirrello

review: Hopefully Amazon reads this review (since its actually there product) and others find it useful. I bought the 2 fire sticks for 19 each (Prime member) because i am trying to get rid of my Xbox, which i never play. It has all the content that the Xbox but the main reason that I bought the Fire Tv stick and that is to mirror my phone to my TV. The product page even says that it supports mirroring from a Samsung device (i have the GS5),. Guess what..It doesn't, after spending 3 hours trying to get it to mirror to the screen, I called amazon support for them to tell me that Samsung as its own Miracast program called Allshare and cant be linked to a Fire Tv stick. I will probably be returning both of my fire TV sticks and just buy a Google ChromeCast. Its just wrong for a company to state  that it's products perform a certain way but never lives up to what it suppose to do.

review: As other reviewers have mentioned, it is problematic when updating.  After many tries the update completed and I thought perhaps  after the update  it might work well.  However, its connectivity consistency is poor. My router is about 3 feet away and yet it disconnects frequently.  That is unacceptable performance.  Why would I bother continuing with this when my bluray player apps for both Netflix and Amazon Video are consistently fine.  On a positive side it does connect more quickly to Netflix and Amazon Video than my bluray player apps.

review: So far, so good. I've played with this now for a couple days, and it's very easy to set up and use. I bought this for my bedroom TV for which it works very well.  I primarily use Netflix and Plex (for local files), but the availability of other sources is good.  The only negative so far is I couldn't power the device from the TV's USB port - it required the power adapter to work properly. But it comes with a pretty long USB cable, so it wasn't a huge issue.
